tit.cmt: 日本語の用語自体が説明されるので、misogiを見出し項目にした。

sen.j: 禊（みそぎ）とは、2つの意味がある。
sen.e: The term,"misogi," (ablution) has two meanings.
The term,"misogi," (ablution) has two meanings.
The term,"misogi," (ablution) has two meanings.

sen.j: 神道や仏教で自分自身の身に穢れのある時や重大な神事などに従う前、又は最中に、自分自身の身を氷水、滝、川や海で洗い清めること。
sen.e: It refers to the washing of oneself in icy water, the river, sea or waterfall in Shinto or Buddhism when one's body is polluted, or before or during an important Shinto ceremony.
It refers to the washing of oneself in icy water, the river, sea or waterfall in Shinto or Buddhism when one's body is polluted, or before or during an important Shinto ceremony.
It refers to the washing of oneself in icy water, the river, sea or waterfall in Shinto or Buddhism when one's body is polluted, or before or during an important Shinto ceremony.

sen.j: 仏教では主に垢離（みずごり）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: In Buddhism, it is primarily called mizugori (purification by cold water).
In Buddhism, it is primarily called mizugori (purification by cold water).
In Buddhism, it is primarily called mizugori (purification by cold water).

sen.j: 用例は万葉集より「君により言の繁きを 故郷の明日香の河に禊しにゆく」 （巻4-626）
sen.e: One of its earliest usage examples is found in the Manyoshu(Collections of Ten Thousand Leaves): "As your love towards me has aroused so much jealousy, I am going to perform my ablutions in the river in my hometown Asuka" (vol. 4-626).

One of its earliest usage examples is found in the Manyoshu(Collections of Ten Thousand Leaves): "As your love towards me has aroused so much jealousy, I am going to perform my ablutions in the river in my hometown Asuka" (vol. 4-626).

One of its earliest usage examples is found in the Manyoshu(Collections of Ten Thousand Leaves): 'As your love towards me has aroused so much jealousy, I am going to perform my ablutions in the river in my hometown Asuka' (vol. 4-626).

sen.j: 禊祓（みそぎはらえ）の略。
sen.e: It is a simplified form of misogiharae (ablution and ritual purification).
It is a simplified form of misogiharae (ablution and ritual purification).
It is a simplified form of misogiharae (ablution and ritual purification).

sen.j: 俳句や短歌などでは、夏の季語に用いられる。
sen.e: It is used as a formulaic word denoting summer in haiku (seventeen-mora poetry) and tanka (thirteen-mora poetry).
sen.cmt: 短歌に季語があるのか？
sen.e: It is used as a formulaic word denoting summer in haiku (seventeen-mora poetry) and tanka (thirteen-mora poetry).
It is used as a season word for summer in haiku (seventeen-mora poetry) and tanka (thirty-one syllables' poem).
sen.cmt: 短歌の定訳季語の訳、用語集のものに変更。短歌に季語はないと思います。

sen.j: 地域によっては、一定の年齢に達した男子（稀に女子）は通過儀礼としての禊をする事によって初めて1人前と認められる場合がある。
sen.e: In some regions boys (and occasionally girls) who come of a certain age may not be recognized as grownups until they perform their ablutions as a passage rite.
In some regions boys (and occasionally girls) who come of a certain age may not be recognized as grownups until they perform their ablutions as a passage rite.
In some regions boys (and occasionally girls) who come of a certain age may not be recognized as grownups until they perform their ablutions as a passage rite.

sen.j: 服装は男女とも白装束が原則だが男子はふんどしの場合もある。
sen.e: In principle, both men and women must be dressed in white, though men may also wear loincloths.
In principle, both men and women must be dressed in white, though men may also wear loincloths.
In principle, both men and women must be dressed in white, though men may also wear loincloths.

sen.j: ふんどしの場合、白の越中褌が原則だが白の六尺褌の場合もある。
sen.e: If a loincloth is worn, it must as a rule be of white Ecchu type but could also be a G-string.
If a loincloth is worn, it must as a rule be of white Ecchu type but could also be a G-string.
If a loincloth is worn, it must as a rule be of white Ecchu type but could also be a G-string.

tit.e: Relationship between Ablutions and Naked Festivals
Relationship between Ablutions and Naked Festivals
Relationship between Ablutions and Naked Festivals

sen.j: 各地の裸祭りの中には、通過儀礼としての禊が祭り化されたものも多い。
sen.e: Many of the naked festivals around the country are festive forms of ablution as a passage rite.
Many of the naked festivals around the country are festive forms of ablution as a passage rite.
Many of the naked festivals around the country are festive forms of ablution as a passage rite.
sen.cmt: are の後のスペース短縮

sen.j: 禊型の裸祭りでは真冬に氷水を浴びたり川や海に入る場合が多いが、この変形として温泉の湯、泥、甘酒、赤飯、等を掛け合うものもある。
sen.e: In naked festivals of ablution type, participants often pour icy water over their heads or go into the river or sea in the middle of winter. In some derived forms of these festivals, people splash one another hot spring water, mud, amazake (sweet alcoholic drink) or festive red rice.

In naked festivals of ablution type, participants often pour icy water over their heads or go into the river or sea in the middle of winter. In some derived forms of these festivals, people splash one another hot spring water, mud, amazake (sweet alcoholic drink) or festive red rice.

In naked festivals of ablution type, participants often pour icy water over their heads or go into the river or sea in the middle of winter. In some derived forms of these festivals, people splash one another hot spring water, mud, amazake (sweet alcoholic drink) or festive red rice.

sen.j: 禊型の裸祭りでは真冬に氷水を浴びたり川や海に入る場合が多い。
sen.e: In naked festivals of ablution type, participants often pour icy water over their heads or go into the river or sea in the middle of winter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In naked festivals of ablution type, participants often pour icy water over their heads or go into the river or sea in the middle of winter.
In naked festivals of ablution type, participants often pour icy water over their heads or go into the river or sea in the middle of winter.

sen.j: この変形として温泉の湯、泥、甘酒、赤飯、等を掛け合うものもある。
sen.e: In some derived forms of these festivals, people splash one another hot spring water, mud, amazake (sweet alcoholic drink) or festive red rice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In some derived forms of these festivals, people splash one another with hot spring water, mud, amazake (sweet alcoholic drink) or festive red rice.
In some derived forms of these festivals, people splash one another with hot spring water, mud, amazake (sweet mild sake) or festive red rice.
sen.cmt: 甘酒の訳、用語集のものに変更。

sen.j: 御輿等を担ぎながら水を浴びたり川や海に入る場合も多いが、これも禊の一種と考えられる。
sen.e: It is also common that participants carrying portable shrines are drenched in water or go into the river or sea. This is also seen as a kind of ablution.
It is also common that participants carrying portable shrines are drenched in water or go into the river or sea. This is also seen as a kind of ablution.
It is also common that participants carrying portable shrines are drenched in water or go into the river or sea. This is also seen as a kind of ablution.

sen.j: 御輿等を担ぎながら水を浴びたり川や海に入る場合も多い。
sen.e: It is also common that participants carrying portable shrines are drenched in water or go into the river or sea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also common that participants carrying portable shrines are drenched in water or go into the river or sea.
It is also common that participants carrying portable shrines are drenched in water or go into the river or sea.

sen.j: これも禊の一種と考えられる。
sen.e: This is also seen as a kind of ablution.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is also seen as a kind of ablution.
This is also seen as a kind of ablution.

sen.j: 神事の前に於ける行として、一般参拝者が手水で清めることも禊の一種である。
sen.e: One of the modern ablutions is a shrine visitor's purifying himself in a purification font as a religious practice before participating in a Shinto ceremony.
One of the modern ablutions is a shrine visitor's purifying himself in a purification font as a religious practice before participating in a Shinto ceremony.
One of the modern ablutions is a shrine visitor's purifying himself in a purification font as a religious practice before participating in a Shinto ceremony.

sen.j: 一方で川や海、滝に入る禊を行う者もある。
sen.e: Some people perform their ablutions by entering the river, sea or waterfall.
Some people perform their ablutions by entering the river, sea or waterfall.
Some people perform their ablutions by entering the river, sea or waterfall.

sen.j: 神社関係者などの研修会等で行われる他、寒中に精神鍛錬の意味合いをもって、神社が主催し、氏子らを集めて行う事もある。
sen.e: This form of ablution is performed by shrine people at a workshop, etc. It can also be organized by a shrine, inviting its parishners for spiritual training in the depth of winter.
This form of ablution is performed by shrine people at a workshop, etc. It can also be organized by a shrine, inviting its parishners for spiritual training in the depth of winter.
This form of ablution is performed by shrine people at a workshop, etc. It can also be organized by a shrine, inviting its parishners for spiritual training in the depth of winter.

sen.j: 神社関係者などの研修会等で行われる。
sen.e: This form of ablution is performed by shrine people at a workshop, etc.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This form of ablution is performed by shrine people at a workshop, etc.
This form of ablution is performed by shrine people at a workshop, etc.

sen.j: また寒中に精神鍛錬の意味合いをもって、神社が主催し、氏子らを集めて行う事もある。
sen.e: It can also be organized by a shrine, inviting its parishners for spiritual training in the depth of winter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It can also be organized by a shrine, inviting its parishners for spiritual training in the depth of winter.
It can also be organized by a shrine, inviting its parishners for spiritual training in the depth of winter.

sen.j: 武道修行者が上記の機会等に、寒稽古の一環として行うこともある。
sen.e: On such an occasion spiritual athletes may perform ablutions as a part of their mid-winter training.
On such an occasion spiritual athletes may perform ablutions as a part of their mid-winter training.
On such an occasion spiritual athletes may perform ablutions as a part of their mid-winter training.

sen.j: また稽古の前に冷水を浴びてから稽古を行う武道家もいる。
sen.e: Some athletes pour cold water over their heads before their training.
Some athletes pour cold water over their heads before their training.
Some athletes pour cold water over their heads before their training.

sen.j: に示した意味が転じて、現代では犯罪を犯した政治家等が、一定の立候補中止期間（冷却期間）を置く事の意味にも使われるようになっている。
sen.e: The first meaning of the word misogi has been extended to mean a certain (cooling-off) period during which a politician who has committed a crime withdraws from his candidacy;
sen.cmt: Wikipediaでは「1.に（示した）」とある。Cell 6のコメントを参照。ここは「一番目の意味」と補って訳出。
sen.e: The first meaning of the word misogi has been extended to mean a certain (cooling-off) period during which a politician who has committed a crime withdraws from his candidacy;
The first meaning of the word misogi has been extended to mean a certain (cooling-off) period during which a politician who has committed a crime withdraws from his candidacy.
sen.cmt: 次にセルに文を繋げていますが、ピリオドで止めました。

sen.j: または、冷却期間を置いた後に再び立候補した選挙を禊と位置付け、当選すれば「禊は済ませた」というようにも使われる。
sen.e: or if the politician stands in election again after the cooling-off period, he recognizes this election as his ablutions. If he is elected, he can then say, "I have performed my ablutions."
or if the politician stands in election again after the cooling-off period, he recognizes this election as his ablutions. If he is elected, he can then say, "I have performed my ablutions."
Or if the politician stands in election again after the cooling-off period, he recognizes this election as his ablutions and if he is elected, he can then say, "I have performed my ablutions."
sen.cmt: 文頭、大文字に変更し、二文に分かれているのを一文にしました。

sen.j: 用例としては「××先生が禊をする」。
sen.e: This word can be used as in, "Mr. So-and-so is going to do his misogi (ablutions)."
This word can be used as in, "Mr. So-and-so is going to do his misogi (ablutions)."
This word can be used as in, 'Mr. So-and-so is going to do his misogi (ablutions).'

sen.j: 御衣木（みそぎ）とは、神仏の像を作るのに用いる木材のこと。
sen.e: A homonym of the Japanese term for ablution refers to wood used to create Shinto or Buddhist statues.
sen.cmt: 原文にはありませんが、禊と御衣木が同音異義語であると説明しないと、英文として成立しないのであえて追加しました。
sen.e: A homonym of the Japanese term for ablution refers to wood used to create Shinto or Buddhist statues.
A homonym of the Japanese term for ablution refers to wood used to create Shinto or Buddhist statues.

sen.j: 檜（ひのき）・百壇（びゃくだん）・栴檀（せんだん）・朴（ほお）の類の木が用いられる。
sen.e: Hinoki cypress, sandalwood, chinaberry, Japanese bigleaf magnolia, etc. are used.
sen.cmt: センダンの通称は他にPersian Liliac, White Ceder, Bead Tree, Lunumidella, Ceylon Cedar
sen.e: Hinoki cypress, sandalwood, chinaberry, Japanese bigleaf magnolia, etc. are used.
Hinoki cypress, sandalwood, chinaberry, Japanese bigleaf magnolia, etc. are used.

sen.j: 大祓（おおはらえ）とは、古来6月及び12月の晦日（つごもり）に、親王以下在京の百官を朱雀門の前に集めて、万民の罪や穢（けがれ）を祓った神事。
sen.e: Oharae is an ancient purification ritual in Shinto, in which the Emperor gathered one-hundred officials at court, including his imperial princes, in front of the Suzaku-mon Gate on the last day of the sixth and twelfth month of the year, to cleanse themselves of sins and pollution.

Oharae is an ancient purification ritual in Shinto, in which the Emperor gathered one-hundred officials at court, including his imperial princes, in front of the Suzaku-mon Gate on the last day of the sixth and twelfth month of the year, to cleanse themselves of sins and pollution.

Oharae is an ancient Shinto purification ritual in which one-hundred court officials (including imperial princes) gathered in front of the Suzaku-mon Gate on the last day of the sixth and twelfth months of the year to cleanse people of their sins and purify them.
sen.cmt: 天皇 が集めたのではないと思います。「万民」の穢れを祓ったので、themselves も違うと思い、書き換えました。

sen.j: 現在も、宮中をはじめ全国各地の神社で行われる。
sen.e: In modern time, too, it is preformed at the Imperial Court as well as shrines around the country.
In modern time, too, it is preformed at the Imperial Court as well as shrines around the country.
In modern time, too, it is preformed at the Imperial Court as well as shrines around the country.

sen.j: 中臣の祓とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also called Nakatominoharae.
It is also called Nakatominoharae.
It is also called Nakatominoharae.

sen.j: また、これらの神事から、俳句や短歌では夏や冬の季語に用いられる。
sen.e: Based on these Shinto rituals, it has been used as a formulaic word symbolizing summer and winter in haiku and tanka.
sen.cmt: 短歌に季語は使用しないはず…
sen.e: Based on these Shinto rituals, it has been used as a formulaic word symbolizing summer and winter in haiku and tanka.
Based on these Shinto rituals, it has been used as a season word symbolizing summer and winter in haiku and tanka.
sen.cmt: 季語の訳、変更and の前のスペース短縮
